column4: Microsoft overtakes Amazon as second most valuable U.S. company
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp  regained its spot as the second most valuable U.S. company on Friday after a disappointing quarterly report from Amazon.com  wiped $65 billion off the online retailer's market capitalization.

column4: UPDATE 1-Microsoft overtakes Amazon as second most valuable U.S. company
column5: (Adds graphic on analyst price targets  updates share prices)     By Noel Randewich     SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 26 Microsoft Corp regained its spot as the second most valuable U.S. company on Friday after a disappointing quarterly report from Amazon.com  wiped $65 billion off the online retailer's market capitalization. column4: UPDATE 2-Weak Amazon  Alphabet results ignite growth worries
column5: Oct 26 Shares of Amazon.com Inc dropped by the most in four years on Friday after its outlook for holiday season sales missed targets  fanning concerns that Wall Street's tech darlings are finally starting to face stronger competition.

column4: Microsoft overtakes Amazon as second most valuable U.S. company
column5: By Noel Randewich     SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 26 Microsoft Corp regained its spot as the second most valuable U.S. company on Friday after a disappointing quarterly report from Amazon.com  wiped $65 billion off the online retailer's market capitalization.     Apple Inc tops the list at over $1 trillion after crossing that threshold in September. column4: UPDATE 2-Tesla says has not received subpoena on Model 3 production
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 26 Tesla Inc has not received a U.S. subpoena related to its Model 3 production forecasts  the electric carmaker said on Friday  following a report https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-faces-deepening-criminal-probe-over-whether-it-misstated-production-figures-1540576636?mod=searchresults&page=1&pos=1 that it faced a deepening criminal probe about the projections.

column4: Tesla says it has not received subpoena on Model 3 production
column5: Oct 26 Tesla Inc said on Friday it had not received a subpoena from the U.S. Department of Justice regarding production guidance for its Model 3 sedans  in response to a Wall Street Journal story https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-faces-deepening-criminal-probe-over-whether-it-misstated-production-figures-1540576636?mod=searchresults&page=1&pos=1 that said the electric carmaker was facing a deeper criminal probe.

column4: Tesla critic Citron makes U-turn ahead of results
column5: NEW YORK Tesla Inc shares jumped more than 12 percent on Tuesday after long-time critic and short-seller Citron Research said it had a change of heart and is now betting the electric automaker's stock will rise. | Video

column4: Intel bucks chip industry woes; powered by PCs  iPhones
column5: Intel Corp beat analysts' estimates for quarterly profit and revenue on Thursday  driven by its high-margin data center business and strong demand for its PC chips  sending its shares up as much as 6.0 percent in extended trading  though those gains later evaporated on concerns about U.S. trade tensions with China.

column4: UPDATE 5-Intel bucks chip industry woes; powered by PCs  iPhones
column5: Oct 25 Intel Corp beat analysts' estimates for quarterly profit and revenue on Thursday  driven by its high-margin data center business and strong demand for its PC chips  sending its shares up as much as 6.0 percent in extended trading  though those gains later evaporated on concerns about U.S. trade tensions with China.
